Sentencas: A comprehensive mathematical model of the performance of the cathode-supported solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with syngas fuel is presented.
Titulo: Optimization of the Interconnect Ribs for a Cathode-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The model couples the intricate interdependency between the ionic conduction, electronic conduction, gas transport, the electrochemical reaction processes in the functional layers and on the electrode/electrolyte interfaces, methane steam reforming (MSR) and the water gas shift reaction (WGSR).
Titulo: Optimization of the Interconnect Ribs for a Cathode-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The validity of the mathematical model is demonstrated by the excellent agreement between the numerical and experimental I-V curves.
Titulo: Optimization of the Interconnect Ribs for a Cathode-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The effect of anode rib width and cathode rib width on gas diffusion and cell performance is examined.
Titulo: Optimization of the Interconnect Ribs for a Cathode-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The results show conclusively that the cell performance is strongly influenced by the rib width.
Titulo: Optimization of the Interconnect Ribs for a Cathode-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: Furthermore, the anode optimal rib width is smaller than that for cathode, which is contrary to anode-supported SOFC.
Titulo: Optimization of the Interconnect Ribs for a Cathode-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: Finally, the formulae for the anode and cathode optimal rib width are given, which provide an easy to use guidance for the broad SOFC engineering community.
Titulo: Optimization of the Interconnect Ribs for a Cathode-Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell
